file_content.text: The Empire might hold us here, but they won't take the spaceport.
General Aves and his escort are waiting on you. Find those supply camps.
General Aves is in the command bunker. You're cleared to enter.
Corporal Hartke? I need to speak with General Aves.
Corporal Hartke? I need to speak with General Aves.
Sorry, Major, but the general's too busy to give you a briefing.
Corporal Hartke? I need to speak with General Aves.
Unless you've all come to enlist, General Aves can't see you.
General Aves isn't here to give out holoprints, citizen.
Corporal Hartke? I need to speak with General Aves.
I'm sorry, Master Jedi, but the general hasn't got time for a formal welcome.
Hold it. Group like you could form your own squad. We need all the help we can get.
Hey--glad I caught you. The Republic needs a Jedi now more than ever.
Major. I'm glad you're here--we could use a good officer.
You for hire? The Republic needs every gun that's willing.
Corellia's under Imperial control. Every squad, soldier and CO in the galaxy is fighting to get her back.
We thought the Empire had taken the planet by force. Turns out they had the Corellian Council's blessing.
I can't see the average Corellian agreeing to that.
What about the people?
The people of Corellia made the first strikes against the Empire. Unfortunately, they didn't do much damage.
Why would the Corellian Council side with the Empire?
But Corellia's Republic!
Credits? Power? No more elections? Your guess is as good as mine.
They deserve whatever the Empire gets and worse.
Dirty rotten traitors.
We'd have to get to them first.
The Empire's taken over factories, shipyards, even local transport. The transport blockade's become the most urgent problem.
The Republic's got allies all over Corellia, but without access to the rocket tram system, most of the Republic army is stuck here.
Where do these rocket trams run?
Stuck how, exactly?
The suspended track's all around Coronet City. It's the only way to reach some areas, and troop deployment's crippled without it.
You need someone skilled to regain access, I take it.
And you want help.
We've got our hands full just holding this spaceport. It's the only pipeline to Corellia we have left.
Shuttles, transports, fighters... there must be alternatives.
Find a way around.
There aren't. And the few troops who managed to get through before the tram system was shut down are running out of time.
Corellia's a Core World, a major industrial hub, and one of the founding members of the Republic. If we fall here, it might be for good.
General Aves knows more about the tram system situation. He wants to see anyone willing to help.
Distractions, reinforcements, an armed escort--whatever the Republic needs.
You can count on me.
Accessing the rocket tram's more a question of safety than firepower.
If it means victory over the Empire, I'm more than willing.
Wherever he needs me.
Some of the Imperials here answer directly to the Emperor. You might be needed everywhere.
The general's in command. I'll follow his orders.
It's my duty to help.
Some special ops think the chain of command doesn't apply. Glad you're not one of them.
Sounds like the tram's the only way out. I don't much like being stranded.
Guess I have no choice.
I'm sure the soldiers we're cut off from don't much like it either.
I'll report to General Aves. Just tell me where to find him.
I need more details.
General Aves has a command bunker here in the spaceport. I'll tell him to expect you.
Corellia's your fight. I've got my own responsibilities.
Not my problem. [Refuse quest]
The Empire wins Corellia, this war is over. We need all the help we can get.
Better get used to this spaceport. Might be as far as the Republic gets.
